body:
## Steps to Reproduce
1. Run multiple unit tests that pass
2. The left gutter icon will not toggle to passing

Notice the first unit test left gutter icon is showing the test failed. It has passed, and is noted in the debug console view. 
![screen shot 2018-02-24 at 11 00 04 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1326504/36633984-9f606ffe-1952-11e8-8f16-7bc7b6ef02af.png)


## Version info

comment_data.body:
The last test gutter button isn't the same as the others when they are passing. 

![screen shot 2018-02-25 at 6 53 57 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1326504/36642802-85ba8542-19f9-11e8-9c14-cd3ca1ebd5be.png)
@branflake2267 : sorry for the slow movement on this one.  Is the source that repros this up on github?  (No worries if not!)

I remember I could reproduce this with a simple unit tests with an expect(true,true) so I didn't upload the source. Several tests that expect something simple like true should do the trick. Having a test fail along the way may have caused this scenario. Would you like me to work something up?
If it's easy, sure thing!  Otherwise I can dig.  Sorry for the slowness on this one!

Finally getting to this and am not able to easily repro.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67586/38575513-752f276c-3cb0-11e8-8376-06dbadc86512.png)

(Making various tests fail and then pass I can't get it in the state you describe.)

@branflake2267 : any thoughts on how I might repro?
I tried replicating it and I'm not seeing it happen again. I think this can be closed.

I figured out a breakable method. 
1. Run all the tests, see that they pass, click on the >> on main and run debug as. 
2. Cause the first test to fail. 
3. Then fix the test. 
3. Then run all the tests again, they should turn all green
4. The first test icon won't reset back to green.
Fantastic.  Thanks!  Bonus points for likely being related to #1821. üëç

Frustratingly, I still haven't been able to reproduce this. ‚òπÔ∏è   I'm beginning to wonder if there isn't weird cached state in your project metadata (the test running does store tokens which it uses to track if a test has been run before).  If you're interested in digging deeper, I'd be curious to know if this happens for a clean project.

Thanks, as always, for the back and forth!
I know the feeling. I'll schedule some time on trying another pass on a clean project. It may take a day or two from this point.
That's great to hear.  I'm thinking this had to do with some kind of cache weirdness that occurred in the course of #1821.  Thanks for your follow-through!

milestone.description: Issues under consideration for upcoming milestones.
milestone.title: On Deck

title: Unit tests all pass but the left gutter icon still showing it failed
